isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - REFRIGERANT SYSTEM SERVICE - ADDING REFRIGERANT TO THE SYSTEM

svcproc.title: ADDING REFRIGERANT TO THE SYSTEM
svcproc.para: When the air conditioning system is low on refrigerant, it can be refilled using a charging station as outlined below.

step1.para: Connect the charging station to the compressor as follows:

step2.para: Close the manifold suction (blue) and discharge (red) valves (turn fully clockwise).
On the HFC-134A station, turn the metric quick-disconnect valves on the blue and red hoses off (turn clockwise).
Remove cap from the compressor suction service port and connect the manifold suction gauge hose (blue).
Remove cap from the compressor discharge service port and connect the manifold discharge gauge hose (red).

step1.para: Fill the charging station with or meter the proper amount of refrigerant (follow equipment maker's instructions).
Connect the service hose (yellow) from the center manifold to the valve on top of the charging station.
Open refrigerant supply valve on the charging station.
Set air conditioning controls at maximum cooling (A/C lever at "COLD," blower switch on "High"). Open the cab doors.
Run the engine at high idle speed.

SLOWLY open suction valve to add refrigerant to the system. Observe the sight glass and add refrigerant until no foaming or bubbles appear in the sight glass. Continue adding refrigerant until 16 oz. (.5 kg) has been added to the system after the sight glass has cleared. DO NOT OVERCHARGE SYSTEM.

caution.para: Do not allow refrigerant to enter the compressor as a liquid as it will cause severe damage to the compressor.

step1.para: Close suction gauge valve and close refrigerant supply valve on the charging station.
After pressure test is completed, disconnect manifold gauge hoses from compressor service ports. Install protective caps on each service port.
Check air conditioning system for refrigerant leaks using an electronic leak detector. Follow equipment manufacturer's instructions.
